First, we would like to clarify that our review is a statement of the evidence related to suicide screening that the USPSTF used to develop its recommendation for suicide screening in primary care in the United States (1). Our task was to accurately characterize the body of evidence by using rigorous systematic review methods. The USPSTF then used this review to interpret the strength and clinical significance of the evidence as it related to primary care.
